Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_763217
DisplayedItem.title: # Right colectomy or cecectomy often includes appendectomy but sometimes follows appendectomy and may need staging.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_763221
DisplayedItem.title: # The grade of the appendiceal and peritoneal tumors is concordant in most instances but can be discordant in some cases. In case of discordance of grades, the final grade should be assigned based on the peritoneal metastasis. (Note D)

ListItem.name: LI_43289
ListItem.title: Tumor invades lamina propria or muscularis mucosa

ListItem.name: LI_51442
ListItem.title: Acellular mucin invades subserosa or mesoappendix but does not extend to serosal surface

ListItem.name: LI_2320
ListItem.title: Tumor invades through muscularis propria into subserosa or mesoappendix but does not extend to serosal surface

ListItem.name: LI_2322
ListItem.title: Tumor directly invades adjacent organ(s) or structure(s) (specify)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_2322_1
Property.val: Tumor directly invades adjacent organ(s) or structure(s)

Question.name: Q_2713
Question.title: Lymphatic and / or Vascular Invasion (Note F)

ListItem.name: LI_355056
ListItem.title: All margins negative for invasive carcinoma

Question.name: Q_355071
Question.title: Distance from Invasive Carcinoma to Closest Mesenteric Margin

Question.name: Q_763222
Question.title: Margin Status for Non-Invasive Tumor (including LAMN and HAMN)#

DisplayedItem.name: DI_763224
DisplayedItem.title: # Presence of acellular mucin is not considered a positive margin in the context of LAMN or HAMN but should be recorded in a comment or note. (Note H)

ListItem.name: LI_763223
ListItem.title: All margins negative for non-invasive tumor

ListItem.name: LI_764145
ListItem.title: Low-grade dysplasia present at proximal margin

ListItem.name: LI_355090
ListItem.title: High-grade dysplasia present at proximal margin

ListItem.name: LI_764144
ListItem.title: Low-grade appendiceal mucinous neoplasm present at margin

Question.title: Margin(s) Involved by Low-grade Appendiceal Mucinous Neoplasm

ListItem.name: LI_355100
ListItem.title: High-grade appendiceal mucinous neoplasm present at margin

Question.name: Q_355101
Question.title: Margin(s) Involved by High-grade Appendiceal Mucinous Neoplasm

ListItem.name: LI_2195
ListItem.title: Not applicable (no regional lymph nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_355114
ListItem.title: All regional lymph nodes negative for tumor

ListItem.name: LI_355115
ListItem.title: Tumor present in regional lymph node(s)

Question.name: Q_34184
Question.title: Number of Lymph Nodes with Tumor

DisplayedItem.name: DI_37061
DisplayedItem.title: For specimens containing acellular mucin without identifiable tumor cells, efforts should be made to obtain additional tissue for thorough histologic examination to evaluate for cellularity.

ListItem.name: LI_355124
ListItem.title: Intraperitoneal acellular mucin without identifiable tumor cells in the disseminated peritoneal mucinous deposits

ListItem.name: LI_355127
ListItem.title: Intraperitoneal metastasis only (including peritoneal mucinous deposits containing tumor cells)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_763230
DisplayedItem.title: # Involvement of organs such as ovary, fallopian tube or spleen underlying involved peritoneum is still considered intraperitoneal metastasis. Involvement of lung or hepatic parenchyma distinct from peritoneal involvement is considered extraperitoneal distant metastasis.

ListItem.name: LI_763229
ListItem.title: Other intraperitoneal metastasis, including peritoneal mucinous deposits containing tumor cells (specify)

ListItem.name: LI_355128
ListItem.title: Site(s) other than peritoneum (specify, if known)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_39806
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_39806_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_327677
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_37691
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

ListItem.name: LI_37692
ListItem.title: pTis: Carcinoma in situ (intramucosal carcinoma; invasion of the lamina propria or extension into but not through the muscularis mucosae)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_763232
DisplayedItem.title: # pTis LAMN is applicable only to LAMN. High-grade appendiceal mucinous neoplasms (HAMN) are staged similar to mucinous adenocarcinoma, even though robust data on HAMN are lacking.

ListItem.name: LI_37693
ListItem.title: pTis (LAMN): Low-grade appendiceal mucinous neoplasm confined to the muscularis propria; Acellular mucin or mucinous epithelium may invade into the muscularis propria. (T1 and T2 are not applicable to LAMN; Acellular mucin or mucinous epithelium that extends into the subserosa or serosa should be classified as T3 or T4a, respectively.)#

ListItem.name: LI_37694
ListItem.title: pT1: Tumor invades the submucosa (through the muscularis mucosa but not into the muscularis propria)

ListItem.name: LI_37695
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria

ListItem.name: LI_37696
ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into the subserosa or the mesoappendix

DisplayedItem.name: DI_52419
DisplayedItem.title: pT4: Tumor invades the visceral peritoneum, including the acellular mucin or mucinous epithelium involving the serosa of the appendix or mesoappendix, and / or directly invades adjacent organs or structures

ListItem.name: LI_37698
ListItem.title: pT4a: Tumor invades through the visceral peritoneum, including the acellular mucin or mucinous epithelium involving the serosa of the appendix or serosa of the mesoappendix

DisplayedItem.name: DI_41398
DisplayedItem.title: ## The text in parentheses is not applicable to pT determination. A tumor grossly adherent to other organs or structures is classified as cT4b; however, if no tumor is identified on pathological examination of the adhesion, the T category assigned is based on the depth of wall invasion observed on microscopic examination (typically pT1-3).

ListItem.name: LI_37699
ListItem.title: pT4b: Tumor directly invades (or adheres to##) adjacent organs or structures

ListItem.name: LI_820584
ListItem.title: (m) multiple primary synchronous tumors in a single organ

ListItem.name: LI_327681
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_327682
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_37702
ListItem.title: pN0: No tumor involvement of regional lymph node(s)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_51872
DisplayedItem.title: pN1: Tumor involvement of one to three regional lymph nodes (tumor in lymph node measuring greater than or equal to 0.2 mm) or any number of tumor deposits is present with no tumor involvement in all identifiable lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_37704
ListItem.title: pN1a: Tumor involvement of one regional lymph node

ListItem.name: LI_37705
ListItem.title: pN1b: Tumor involvement of two or three regional lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_37706
ListItem.title: pN1c: No tumor involvement of regional lymph nodes, but there are tumor deposits in the subserosa or mesentery

ListItem.name: LI_37707
ListItem.title: pN2: Tumor involvement of four or more regional lymph nodes

DisplayedItem.title: # For specimens containing acellular mucin without identifiable tumor cells, efforts should be made to obtain additional tissue for thorough histologic examination to evaluate for cellularity.

ListItem.name: LI_37709
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

DisplayedItem.title: pM1: Microscopic confirmation of distant metastasis
